intro: Hieracium polygonatum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to August, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium polygonatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can form dense colonies due to its prolific seed production.
